ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Lateral Hydrocephalus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: CT scans revealed enlarged lateral ventricles and absence of the third ventricle, likely secondary to aqueductal stenosis, consistent with symptoms of headache, nausea, and dizziness.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess peripheral hearing sensitivity given the patient's complaints.
To assess central auditory function, investigating potential neuro-auditory involvement.
To evaluate the integrity of the auditory brainstem pathways.
To assess cortical auditory processing and cognitive integration.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing was largely normal, with only a mild low-frequency sensorineural loss in the left ear. However, central auditory testing revealed significant bilateral deficits in dichotic listening and temporal patterning, and a complete absence of the P300 potential despite normal ABR and N1/P2 responses. These findings suggest subcortical dysfunction likely due to the lateral hydrocephalus affecting structures such as the caudate or internal capsule.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear thresholds within normal limits (0-15 dB HL). Left ear showed mild low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss (35 dB at 250 Hz) rising to normal limits above 1000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word recognition scores were excellent (96%) bilaterally.

tests.name: Central Auditory Processing Battery
tests.result_summary: Bilateral deficits on Dichotic Digits (~70-75%) and Frequency Patterns (<60%). Compressed speech showed a slight left ear deficit (~70%) compared to the right (~85%).

tests.name: Late Latency Response (P300)
tests.result_summary: N1 and P2 components were normal. The P300 component was essentially absent bilaterally.

counseling_actions: Explain that peripheral hearing sensitivity is mostly normal.
Discuss how the neurological condition is affecting the brain's ability to process complex signals (dichotic, patterns).
Explain the correlation between the absent P300 and cognitive/attention integration issues.
Reassure that the basic auditory pathway to the brainstem (ABR) is intact.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient requires medical management (shunting) for lateral hydrocephalus given severe and progressive neurological symptoms.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor symptom resolution and return to function following medical intervention.

expected_outcome: Patient did well after bilateral shunts were placed in the lateral ventricles.
At 1 year follow-up, she was without symptoms and back at her job.
Subjectively, she had no hearing difficulties.
Follow-up audiologic testing could not be completed due to logistical reasons.
